Description: Blue glazed composition shabti of a chantress of Amun with painted detail: a lappet-wig tied with a black fillet, a modelled face with traced eyes, a black collar, crossed arms in relief with black bracelets and holding two black hoes, the front of the leg section is inscribed with a column of black painted Hieroglyphs, the flat back is decorated with a representation of a black seed-basket.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Somerset Lowry-Corry, 2nd Earl of Belmore
